com.github.lazoyoung.craftgames.api.module

Interface ItemModule


  • public ItemModule

    • Constructor Detail

      • ItemModule

        public ItemModule()

    • Method Detail

      • spawnItem

        void spawnItem(@NotNull
               java.lang.String tag,
               @NotNull
               org.bukkit.inventory.ItemStack itemStack)

        Spawn a floating item.

        Parameters:
        tag - Name of the coordinate tag designating the spawnpoint.
        itemStack - ItemStack which represents attribute of the item.

      • getLootTable

        @Nullable
org.bukkit.loot.LootTable getLootTable(@NotNull
                                                  org.bukkit.NamespacedKey key)

        Find LootTable by the key.

        Custom LootTables can be added by installing datapacks in the server.

        See Also:
        LootTable, key

      • allowKit

        void allowKit(boolean respawn)

        Let the players select kit inside lobby or during respawn cooldown.

        Parameters:
        respawn - Determines if players are allowed to choose kit or not.

      • preventItemDrop

        void preventItemDrop()

        Prevent players from dropping items.

      • lockInventory

        void lockInventory()

        Lock inventory so that players won't be able to move items in it.

      • setDefaultKit

        void setDefaultKit(@Nullable
                   java.lang.String name)

        Default kit is assigned to players who don't select anything.

        To assign kit per team, see TeamModule.setKit

        Parameters:
        name - The name of kit. Pass null to assign nothing.
        See Also:
        TeamModule.setKit

      • selectKit

        void selectKit(@Nullable
               java.lang.String name,
               @NotNull
               org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

        Select the player's kit.

        Upon death, player's state is restored again with this kit. You can still use this function even if you disallow players to select one.

        Parameters:
        name - The kit name. (Pass null to de-select)
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException - is thrown if kit cannot be located or is not allowed for the player.
        See Also:
        player, allowKit

      • applyKit

        void applyKit(@NotNull
              org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

        Apply the selected kit to the player.

        After clearing up the inventory, contents are supplied.

        See Also:
        player

      • saveKit

        void saveKit(@NotNull
             java.lang.String name,
             @NotNull
             org.bukkit.entity.Player player)

        Save kit with the given name. If there's an existing kit, this will overwrite it.

        The Player's inventory and point effects are captured.

        Parameters:
        name - Name of the kit.
        See Also:
        name, Player
